channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump is loosening red tape to help America’s $20 billion seafood trade deficit. Conservation groups worry overfishing could unravel the ocean’s ‘safety net’
item.description: Trump's executive order drew praise from commercial fishing groups and condemnation from environmental organizations.

item.title: This non-profit tested common toothpaste brands for toxic metals. Here’s what it found
item.description: Common toothpaste brands may be harboring toxic metals like lead.

item.title: Bill Ackman makes big bet on Hertz becoming tariff winner
item.description: Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square Capital Management has amassed a nearly 20% stake in Hertz.

item.title: Court filings describe DOGE-led, scream-filled, 36-hour mass layoff scramble at consumer protection agency
item.description: As the Trump administration seeks to gut the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, employees are fighting back.

item.title: The IRS interim commissioner was just ousted after Scott Bessent reportedly fussed to Trump that Elon Musk installed the leader behind his back
item.description: Gary Shapley was named the new agency leader on Tuesday.

item.title: Where Trump’s trade deals with China, Europe, Japan and other countries stand
Trump won’t fire Powell — but he could still pressure the Fed. Here's how.
The ‘smart money’ index is acting unusual. It could be a buying opportunity.
Why Trump Media once again called out ‘naked short selling’ as its stock dropped
Why silver could finally be a better investment opportunity than gold
